title: Pointwise User Group Meetings
description: The Pointwise User Group Meeting is a great opportunity to gather together for several days of sharing best practices, success stories, and expertise on mesh generation and computational fluid dynamics.
copy:
Pointwise User Group Meetings

The Pointwise User Group Meeting is a great opportunity to gather together for several days of sharing best practices, success stories, and expertise on mesh generation and computational fluid dynamics. It is an opportunity to meet virtually everyone at Pointwise to get their insight on meshing technology. We also get to learn from you the challenges you face in the daily application of CFD to real-world problems.

Pointwise User Group Meetings

Some of the world’s top computational fluid dynamics (CFD) engineers attended the Pointwise User Group Meetings because they have made Pointwise their choice for CFD meshing. The meetings included hands-on demos of Pointwise's latest features and included consultations with our expert staff to help solve our users' preprocessing issues.

For a list of Pointwise's up-coming events, you can go to our events page. You can also subscribe to This Week at Pointwise, our weekly newsletter that includes Pointwise and CFD news.

Pointwise User Group Meeting 2018

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2018 held in Fort Worth, Texas, on 14-15 November drew mesh generation experts from around the world. The two-day event included hands-on training in Pointwise, best practices discussions with our meshing experts, presentations on leading-edge applications of meshing and CFD from practitioners, conversations with CFD software providers whose products complement Pointwise, and the presentation of the Meshy Award.

See Overview

Pointwise User Group Meeting 2016

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2016 held in Fort Worth, Texas on 21-22 September drew attendees from around the world and included technical presentations on subjects ranging from aircraft and race car aerodynamics to construction of 3-D printed sculptures. The meeting also featured hands-on Pointwise V18 training, a short-course entitled “Advanced Geometry Cleanup,” and the presentation of the Meshy Award.

See Overview

Pointwise User Group Meeting 2014

Pointwise celebrated its 20th anniversary in 2014, and we topped off the festivities with a special edition of our Pointwise User Group Meeting on 29-30 October 2014 in Anaheim, California.

See Overview

Pointwise User Group Meeting 2013

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2013 was held in Fort Worth, Texas on 19-20 March. The meeting featured hands-on training in the Pointwise software, presentations from customers from around the world, a user-chosen short-course titled “Meshing Forensics,” and the presentation of the Meshy Award.

See Overview

Pointwise User Group Meeting 2011

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2011 held in Fort Worth, Texas on 8-9 November drew the largest attendance in the history of the company's user conference. The meeting featured hands-on training in Pointwise V17, presentations from customers from around the world, a short-course entitled “T-Rex in the Real World,” and the presentation of the Meshy Award.

See Overview

Pointwise User Group Meeting 2010

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2010 was held in Fort Worth, Texas on April 13-14, 2010. The meeting featured special Pointwise and Gridgen training seminars, presentations by Pointwise staff on new product developments, exhibits by our partners and user presentations, and general mesh generation excitement.

See Overview

Pointwise User Group Meeting 2008

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2008 was held in Fort Worth, Texas on November 5-6, 2008. Events included special Pointwise and Gridgen training seminars, presentations by Pointwise staff on new product developments, exhibits by our partners, and user presentations.

See Overview

Pointwise User Group Meeting 2006

The third annual Gridgen User Group Meeting was held at the Sheraton Grand Hotel at Dallas/Fort Worth Airport in Irving, Texas on April 24-25, 2006. The meeting included special Gridgen training seminars, presentations by Pointwise staff on new Gridgen developments, exhibits by our partners, and user presentations. This year, attendees also had an opportunity to "kick the tires" of our next generation meshing software at the V16 Test Drive.

See Overview

Pointwise User Group Meeting 2005

Pointwise's second Gridgen User Group Meeting was held on April 25-26, 2005 at the Renaissance Worthington Hotel in our hometown of Fort Worth, Texas. It was a great success and brought together our customers, our partners, and our staff for two days of intense sharing of meshing expertise.

See Overview

Pointwise User Group Meeting 2004

Pointwise's inaugural Gridgen User Group Meeting was held on April 5-6, 2004 at the Renaissance Worthington Hotel here in our hometown of Fort Worth, Texas. It was a great success and brought together our customers, our partners, and our staff for two days of intense sharing of meshing expertise. Our keynote speaker was Prof. David Whitfield from the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga.

See Overview

title: Gridgen User Group Meeting 2004
description: Pointwise's inaugural Gridgen User Group Meeting was held on April 5-6, 2004 at the Renaissance Worthington Hotel here in our hometown of Fort Worth, Texas.
copy:
Gridgen User Group Meeting 2004

Pointwise's innaugural Gridgen User Group Meeting was held on April 5-6, 2004 at the Renaissance Worthington Hotel here in our hometown of Fort Worth, Texas. It was a great success and brought together our customers, our partners, and our staff for two days of intense sharing of meshing expertise. Our keynote speaker was Prof. David Whitfield from the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga. Dr. Whitfield is Director of the Graduate School of Computational Engineering at the University of Tennessee (UT) at Chattanooga (UTC) and also Director of the UT SimCenter at Chattanooga. He obtained his undergraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering from Oklahoma State University and obtained both his Master's and Ph.D. degrees in Aerospace Engineering from the University of Tennessee.

CFD Gallery & Exhibits

title: Gridgen User Group Meeting 2005
description: Pointwise's second Gridgen User Group Meeting was held on April 25-26, 2005 at the Renaissance Worthington Hotel in our hometown of Fort Worth, Texas.
copy:
Gridgen User Group Meeting 2005

Pointwise's second Gridgen User Group Meeting was held on April 25-26, 2005 at the Renaissance Worthington Hotel in our hometown of Fort Worth, Texas. It was a great success and brought together our customers, our partners, and our staff for two days of intense sharing of meshing expertise.

Our keynote presentation was titled "Sustainable Improvements in Analysis Throughput - a DOE Perspective" by Dr. Ted Blacker of Sandia National Laboratories. Dr. Blacker currently manages DART, a large portfolio of DOE funded projects aimed at significantly reducing overall design through analysis times. He also spent eight years at Fluent, Inc. where he led a team that developed Fluent's GAMBIT preprocessing product. Dr. Blacker received his PhD in Theoretical and Applied Mechanics from Northwestern University in 1993.

CFD Gallery & Exhibits

title: Gridgen User Group Meeting 2006
description: The third annual Gridgen User Group Meeting was held at the Sheraton Grand Hotel at Dallas/Fort Worth Airport in Irving, Texas on April 24-25, 2006.
copy:
Gridgen User Group Meeting 2006

April 24-25, 2006

The third annual Gridgen User Group Meeting was held at the Sheraton Grand Hotel at Dallas/Fort Worth Airport in Irving, Texas on April 24-25, 2006. The meeting included special Gridgen training seminars, presentations by Pointwise staff on new Gridgen developments, exhibits by our partners, and user presentations. This year, attendees also had an opportunity to "kick the tires" of our next generation meshing software at the V16 Test Drive.

CFD Gallery & Exhibits

Hybrid Meshing Seminars

Users interested in learning more about the hands-on use of Gridgen are invited to the Gridgen Seminars on Monday, April 24. The topic of both seminars will be Gridgen's hybrid meshing capability. The first seminar will provide an introduction to the basics of hybrid meshing for the new user. The second seminar delves deeper into the topic including advanced features and tricks to get the most out of the hybrid meshing.

Keynote Speaker

The Gridgen User Group Meeting 2006 keynote presentation was given by Dr. Bill Clark. Dr. Clark is the Director of Engineering Software Business Unit at CD-adapco, a leading Computational Fluid Dynamics software and solutions provider. He is responsible for directing CD-adapco's American business operations including software sale and support. Dr. Clark received his undergraduate degree in aerospace engineering from Purdue University. Dr. Clark later went on to obtain a Masters and Ph.D. from Duke University where his research focused on the numerical simulation of unsteady aerodynamics and aeroelasticity of rotating machinery. Dr. Clark has worked both in industry - Allison Gas Turbine and Rolls Royce and academia - Research Professor Duke University - prior to joining CD-adapco in 2000. He is a member of the ASME and the AIAA and has CFD related publications in journals, conference proceedings and trade magazines.

V16 Test Drive

Gridgen User Group Meeting attendees had the opportunity to experience our next-generation meshing software during the V16 Test Drive on Tuesday afternoon. After Pointwise's presentation about The Future of Gridgen, workstations were available for attendees to use and comment on a pre-release version of V16.

title: Pointwise User Group Meeting 2008
description: The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2008 was held in Fort Worth, Texas on November 5-6, 2008.
copy:
Pointwise User Group Meeting 2008

November 05-06, 2008

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2008 was held in Fort Worth, Texas on November 5-6, 2008. Events included special Pointwise and Gridgen training seminars, presentations by Pointwise staff on new product developments, exhibits by our partners, and user presentations.

CFD Gallery & Exhibits

Special time will be available during the Pointwise User Group Meeting for you to visit with our exhibiting partners and learn more about how Gridgen and Pointwise complement their products offerings. For more information about our partners, see the Pointwise UGM CFD Gallery page.

Special Pointwise and Gridgen Training Sessions

Training sessions on Wednesday, November 5 will cover the latest features in both Pointwise and Gridgen. The Gridgen session will cover new features that you may not be aware of that can save time meshing. An introductory section for Pointwise will help users new to the software pick up some of the basics of the interface. A Pointwise preview session will allow attendees to see the new features coming in the next release of Pointwise. The training sessions will also include hands-on exercises for attendees to try out firsthand the features discussed.

Keynote Speaker

We are pleased to announce that the Pointwise User Group Meeting 2008 keynote presentation will be given by Mr. Jon Beesley, Director and Chief Test Pilot at Lockheed Martin Aeronautics. Mr. Beesley is currently the Chief Test Pilot on the F-35 Joint Strike Fighter and made the first flight of that aircraft on 15 December 2006. For his work on the F-35 Mr. Beesley was awarded his second Ivan C. Kincheloe award from the Society of Experimental Test Pilots. His first Kincheloe was awarded based on his contributions to the F-117 stealth fighter program on which he was one of the first pilots. Mr. Beesley has also contributed to the flight test programs of the F-22 Raptor and F-16 Red Eye. For his career achievements as a test pilot, Mr. Beesley was awarded the Chuck Yeager award in 2000 by the Engineers Council of Southern California. For a detailed biography, click here.

title: Pointwise User Group Meeting 2010
description: The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2010 was held in Fort Worth, Texas on April 13-14, 2010.
copy:
Pointwise User Group Meeting 2010

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2010 was held in Fort Worth, Texas on April 13-14, 2010. The meeting featured special Pointwise and Gridgen training seminars, presentations by Pointwise staff on new product developments, exhibits by our partners and user presentations, and general mesh generation excitement.

CFD Gallery & Exhibits

Special time will be available during the Pointwise User Group Meeting for you to visit with our exhibiting partners and learn more about how Gridgen and Pointwise complement their products offerings.

Special Pointwise and Gridgen Training Sessions

Training sessions on Tuesday, April 13, 2010 covered the latest features in both Pointwise and Gridgen. The Gridgen session included new features that you may not be aware of that can save time meshing. An introductory section for Pointwise helped users new to the software pick up some of the basics of the interface. A Pointwise preview session will allow attendees to see the new features coming in the next release of Pointwise. The training sessions also will include hands-on exercises for attendees to try firsthand the features discussed.

title: Pointwise User Group Meeting 2011
description: The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2011 held in Fort Worth, Texas on 8-9 November drew the largest attendance in the history of the company's user conference.
copy:
Pointwise User Group Meeting 2011

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2011 held in Fort Worth, Texas on 8-9 November drew the largest attendance in the history of the company's user conference. The meeting featured hands-on training in Pointwise V17, presentations from customers from around the world, a short-course entitled “T-Rex in the Real World,” and the presentation of the Meshy Award.

Photos from the event are available on Pointwise's Facebook page.

  • Software Training and Short Course
  • Opening Reception
  • Presentations

Exhibiting Partners

We are pleased to have had several of our partners participate in the CFD Gallery at this year's user group meeting. Our attendees benefited from time spent with our partners discussing how their solutions complement Pointwise.

Meshy Award Contest

Dr. Michael Böttcher of Karlsruher Institut fuer Technologie was presented the first Meshy Award, given for a Pointwise/Gridgen mesh that is technically excellent and aesthetically beautiful. Dr. John Steinbrenner, Pointwise vice president of research and development, presented the award. Dr. Böttcher's work was featured on a T-shirt that was distributed at the user group meeting. Dr. Böttcher's award winning meshes are available for viewing along with the other entries in our Meshy Award 2011 photo album on Facebook.

title: Pointwise User Group Meeting 2013
description: The Pointwise User Group Meeting was held 19-20 March 2013 in Fort Worth, Texas.
copy:
Pointwise User Group Meeting 2013

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2013 was held in Fort Worth, Texas on 19-20 March. The meeting featured hands-on training in the Pointwise software, presentations from customers from around the world, a user-chosen short-course titled “Meshing Forensics,” and the presentation of the Meshy Award.

Photos from the event can be seen in an album on Facebook.

Exhibiting Partners

We are pleased to have had several of our partners participate in the CFD Gallery at this year's user group meeting. Our attendees benefited from time spent with our partners discussing how their solutions complement Pointwise.

The Meshy Award

A team of engineers from CRAFT Tech was awarded this year's Meshy Award, an award that recognizes a mesh for its visual appeal, originality, and uniqueness. Dr. John Steinbrenner, Pointwise vice president of research and development, presented the award to Jeremy Shipman who accepted on behalf of his co-workers Vineet Ahuja, James Chenoweth, Don Kenzakowski, and Zisen Liu. The CRAFT Tech mesh was featured on a T-shirt that was distributed at the user group meeting. The award winning meshes are available for viewing along with the other entries in our Meshy Award 2013 photo album on Facebook.

title: Pointwise User Group Meeting 2014
description: Pointwise celebrated its 20th anniversary in 2014, and we topped off the festivities with a special edition of our Pointwise User Group Meeting on 29-30 October 2014 in Anaheim, California.
copy:
Celebrate 20 Years of Reliable CFD Meshing

Pointwise celebrated its 20th anniversary in 2014, and we topped off the festivities with a special edition of our Pointwise User Group Meeting on 29-30 October 2014 in Anaheim, California.

Photos from the event can be seen in an album on Facebook.

Exhibiting Partners

The Meshy Award

Prof. Rickard Bensow of Chalmers University of Technology has been named recipient of the Pointwise Meshy Award for his grids relating to how cavitation on a ship propeller is affected by the installation upstream of energy efficiency improving stator blades that change the propeller inflow.

All of this year's entries can be seen in a Facebook photo album.

title: Pointwise User Group Meeting 2016
description: The Pointwise User Group Meeting was held 21-22 September 2016 in Fort Worth, Texas.
copy:
Pointwise User Group Meeting 2016

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2016 held in Fort Worth, Texas on 21-22 September drew attendees from around the world and included technical presentations on subjects ranging from aircraft and race car aerodynamics to construction of 3-D printed sculptures. The meeting also featured hands-on Pointwise V18 training, a short-course entitled “Advanced Geometry Cleanup,” and the presentation of the Meshy Award.

Photos from the event can be seen in an album on Facebook.

Exhibiting Partners

The Meshy Award

This year's winners of the Pointwise Meshy Award Contest were C. Bruce Hilbert, Ph.D. and Melody Rees of Branch Technology. The winning 3-D structured Pointwise grid was used for the purpose of printing a 3-D pavilion on view at Cheekwood Gardens in Nashville, Tennessee.

All of this year's entries can be seen in a Facebook photo album.

title: Pointwise User Group Meeting 2018
description: The Pointwise User Group Meeting was held 14-15 November 2018 in Fort Worth, Texas.
copy:
Pointwise User Group Meeting 2018

The Pointwise User Group Meeting 2018 held in Fort Worth, Texas, on 14-15 November drew mesh generation experts from around the world. The two-day event included hands-on training in Pointwise, best practices discussions with our meshing experts, presentations on leading-edge applications of meshing and CFD from practitioners, conversations with CFD software providers whose products complement Pointwise, and the presentation of the Meshy Award.

Photos from the event can be seen in an album on Facebook.

Exhibiting Partners

The Meshy Award

This year's winner of the Pointwise Meshy Award Contest was Tim Weathers of Combustion Research and Flow Technology, Inc. The winning mixed-element unstructured grid was constructed for CFD simulations of a compressor test loop as part of a study to develop an advanced real-fluid numerical framework for modeling supercritical CO2 based power cycles for advanced power systems.

title: Pointwise User Group Meeting 2018 - Training Preparation
description: The Pointwise User Group Meeting training course is coming up soon! To make the course as productive as possible, please prepare your laptop prior to attending by following the steps below to download and install your license, Pointwise, and all exercise files.
copy:
Pointwise User Group Meeting 2018

Training Preparation

The Pointwise User Group Meeting training course is coming up soon! To make the course as productive as possible, please prepare your laptop prior to attending by following the steps below to download and install your license, Pointwise, and all exercise files.

1.Download Your Training License File.

Click on the file below to save your training license file to a temporary location that will be easy to find:

PUGM_Training_License.lic

2. Download Pointwise.

The current production release is Pointwise V18.2.
Platform (Right click, Save Link As…) Size (MB)
Windows 64-bit pw-V18.2R1-win64-jre.exe 656
Linux 64-bit pw-V18.2R1-linux_x86_64-jre.sh 640
macOS 64-bit pw-V18.2R1-macosx.dmg 709

Please review the minimum requirements for your platform before installation.

3. Install Pointwise.

  1. Run the Pointwise installer.
    1. IMPORTANT: Install Pointwise as Administrator/root on Windows machines.
  2. Accept the Right-to-Use license and use all defaults for the installation.
  3. Pointwise should launch after you click Finish.
    1. The Pointwise License Wizard will appear when Pointwise is unable to find a license server.
    2. Select “Specify a License File” then click Next.
    3. Navigate to the folder containing the training license downloaded in Step 1. Select the license file and click Open.
    4. Click Next then Finish.

4. Download Training Example Files.

Click on the link below to download the example files you will use for the hands-on exercises in the training course. Save and unzip these files to a location you can easily find during the course.

PUGM2018_Training.zip
